definition: lit. to share the same bed with different dreams (idiom); ostensible partners with different agendas/strange bedfellows/marital dissension
dream/CL:場|场[chang2],個|个[ge4]/(bound form) to dream
endgame/conclusion/outcome/final part of a chess game
The Thirty-Six Stratagems, a Chinese essay used to illustrate a series of stratagems used in politics, war, and in civil interaction/all the possible schemes and stratagems
lit. to point at the mulberry tree and curse the locust tree/fig. to scold sb indirectly/to make oblique accusations (idiom)
lit. to fall behind Sun Shan 孫山|孙山[Sun1 Shan1] (who came last in the imperial examination) (idiom)/fig. to fail an exam/to fall behind (in a competition)
the appearance of unity, but divided at heart (idiom); seeming harmony belies underlying disagreement
to harm others without benefiting oneself (idiom)
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to shoot without aim (idiom); fig. to speak without thinking/firing blindly/to shoot in the air/a shot in the dark
